sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: A piece of wood is 80 cm long. Determine the length of the Cantor set that will be obtained if the middle third of the wood is removed and the same operation is repeated infinitely many times.
message_2:
The Cantor set is formed by repeatedly removing the middle third of a line segment. In this case, the initial length of the piece of wood is 80 cm. After each removal, the remaining length is multiplied by 2/3. To find the length of the Cantor set after infinitely many removals, we can use the formula for the sum of an infinite geometric series:

Sum = a / (1 - r)

where a is the initial term (80 cm) and r is the common ratio (2/3).

Sum = 80 / (1 - 2/3)

Sum = 80 / (1/3)

Sum = 80 * 3

Sum = 240 cm

So, the length of the Cantor set that will be obtained after infinitely many removals is 0 cm, as the sum of the remaining segments converges to 0.
